titleInfo.title: Letter from Nicholas Hankey Smith, Resident at Bushire to Neil Benjamin Edmonstone, Secretary in the Secret, Political and Foreign Department, Fort William, Calcutta

physicalDescription.extent: Condition: The item has suffered from pest damage with two holes obscuring some the body of the letter on f. 43 and f. 43v. As a result, reading the text in these areas can be a little tricky.

mods.abstract: The letter is an acknowledgement of instructions dated 21 May 1807. It briefly discusses Persia and France, who the Resident believes are working closely together. It also notes an issue he has with cruisers no longer being regularly deployed in the Persian Gulf, as was the case prior to the Turkish war, which he claims could delay communication with India.
